topic.title: PHY <-> FlexE <-> MAC to Interlaken Datapaths

li.p: Any FlexE client rate to Interlaken via flexible rate MACs (4).

fig.title: PHY <-> FlexE <-> MAC to Interlaken Datapaths

body.p: On the receive path, the different 100GE PHYs of a FlexE Group comes from the SERDES and then go through the PHY RX blocks that performs the PMA, FEC and PCS functions. The traffic goes to the FLEX_DEMUX which terminates the FlexE Group and extract the FlexE clients. The traffic then passes through the MAC which delineates Ethernet packets, deleting all idles and ordered sets. These packets are forwarded and get stored in the DCPB packet buffer. The MAC provides full PMON while the FEPP_I provides packet insertion and extraction capabilities. The packets are then extracted from the DCPB packet buffer, go through the COPI subsystem and delivered over the Interlaken interface.

On the transmit path, the packets are received over the Interlaken interface, go through the COPI subsystem and get stored in the DCPB packet buffer. These packets are received from the DCPB packet buffer. The MAC provides full PMON while the FEPP_E provides packet insertion and extraction capabilities. The FLEXE_MUX multiplexes these clients into a Flex group. The PHY rate information (usually nominal) is given to the SERDES outside the ENET subsystem. The SERDES then backpressures the TX PHY and the FLEXE_MUX.

draft-comment.author: hookerje
draft-comment.i: [DDD/HWS] SW/Apps to add API and datapath segment configuration content here.
